parts.text: {"word":"public-service-oriented","priority":"☆☆☆","meanings":[{"part_of_speech":"adjective","definition":"公共奉仕志向の、公共サービスを重視する","english_definition":"Focused on or dedicated to providing services that benefit the public; prioritizing the needs and well-being of the community.","examples":[{"sentence":"The organization is public-service-oriented, offering free healthcare to low-income families.","translation":"その組織は公共奉仕志向であり、低所得者層の家族に無料の医療を提供している。"},{"sentence":"She chose a career in social work because she wanted to be in a public-service-oriented profession.","translation":"彼女は公共奉仕志向の職業に就きたかったので、ソーシャルワークの道を選んだ。"},{"sentence":"The university's curriculum is designed to produce public-service-oriented graduates who will contribute to society.","translation":"その大学のカリキュラムは、社会に貢献する公共奉仕志向の卒業生を育成するように設計されている。"}],"collocations":["public-service-oriented organization (公共奉仕志向の組織)","public-service-oriented career (公共奉仕志向のキャリア)","public-service-oriented program (公共奉仕志向のプログラム)","public-service-oriented approach (公共奉仕志向のアプローチ)","public-service-oriented individual (公共奉仕志向の個人)"],"synonyms":["community-minded","civic-minded","altruistic","socially responsible","dedicated to public welfare"],"antonyms":["self-serving","profit-driven","private-sector-focused","commercial"],"related_terms":["public service","community service","social responsibility","public welfare","non-profit"],"usage_notes":{"explanation":"\"Public-service-oriented\" describes an individual, organization, or program that prioritizes serving the public good. It emphasizes a commitment to improving the lives of others and contributing to the well-being of the community. This term is often used in the context of government, non-profit organizations, and social work.","priority":"★★☆"}],"etymology":{"value":"The term is a compound adjective formed by combining \"public service\" (activities or services provided for the benefit of the public) and \"oriented\" (directed or focused towards a particular thing).","priority":"★☆☆"},"pronunciation":{"ipa":"/ˌpʌblɪk ˈsɜːrvɪs ˈɔːriˌɛntɪd/","syllables":"pub-lic-ser-vice-o-ri-en-ted"},"inflection":{"notes":"This is an adjective and does not have different inflections."},"level_frequency":{"CEFR":"C1-C2","frequency_google_ngram":"Low frequency","priority":"★☆☆"},"readability_explanation":{"level":"C1","text":"The term \"public-service-oriented\" is used to describe individuals, organizations, or initiatives that are primarily focused on providing services and benefits to the public. It suggests a dedication to the well-being of the community and a commitment to serving the common good. This term is often used in professional and academic contexts, particularly when discussing careers, organizations, or policies related to public service, social work, or government. Understanding this term requires a good grasp of abstract concepts and a familiarity with the vocabulary used in discussions of social responsibility and community involvement."},"example_sentences":[{"sentence":"The new mayor promised to implement more public-service-oriented policies to address the city's challenges.","translation":"新しい市長は、市の課題に対処するために、より公共奉仕志向の政策を実施することを約束した。","type":"general"},{"sentence":"Many young people are seeking public-service-oriented jobs where they can make a real difference in the world.","translation":"多くの若者が、世界に真の変化をもたらすことができる公共奉仕志向の仕事を探している。","type":"career"},{"sentence":"The foundation supports public-service-oriented research projects that aim to improve public health.","translation":"その財団は、公衆衛生の向上を目的とした公共奉仕志向の研究プロジェクトを支援している。","type":"organization"}]}
